chapter.para: Before you begin the installation, please make sure your system meets all the requirements listed below.

sect1.title: Cluster Size Requirements
sect1.para: &productname; is a dedicated cluster operating system and only functions in a multi-node configuration. It requires a connected group of four or more physical or virtual machines.
The minimum supported cluster size is four nodes: a single &admin_node;, one &master_node;, and two &worker_node;s.

note.title: Test and Proof-of-Concept Clusters
note.para: It is possible to provision a three-node cluster with only a single &worker_node;, but this is not a supported configuration for deployment.

sect1.para: For improved performance, multiple &master_node;s are supported, but there must always be an odd number. For cluster reliability, when using multiple master nodes, some form of DNS load-balancing should be used.
Any number of &worker_node;s may be added up to the maximum cluster size. For the current maximum supported number of nodes, please refer to the Release Notes on .

sect1.title: Minimum Node Specification
sect1.para: Each node in the cluster must meet the following minimum specifications. All these specifications must be adjusted according to the expected load and type of deployments.

listitem.para: AMD64/Intel* EM64T processor (4 core highly recommended)
32-bit processors are not supported

Although it may be possible to install &productname; with less memory than recommended, there is a high risk that the operating system will run out of memory and subsequently causes a cluster failure.

note.title: Swap partitions
note.para: For technical reasons, an &admin_node; installed from an ISO image will have a small swap partition which will be disabled after installation. Nodes built using &ay; do not have a swap partition.

listitem.para: 40 GB for the root file system with Btrfs and enabled snapshots.

note.title: Cloud default root volume size
note.para: In some Public Cloud frameworks the default root volume size of the images is smaller than 40GB. You must resize the root volume before instance launch using the command line tools or the web interface for the framework of your choice.

listitem.para: IOPS: 500 sequential IOPS
Write Performance: 10MB/s

note.title: etcd Storage requirements
note.para: Storage performance requirements are tied closely to the etcd hardware recommendations

listitem.para: All nodes should to be on the same network. It is important that the nodes can communicate without interruptions.
A DHCP server to dynamically provide IP addresses and host names for the nodes in your cluster (unless you configure all nodes statically).
It is recommended to let the DHCP server provide not only the IP addresses but also the host names of the cluster nodes.
A DNS server to resolve host names. Please make sure you have reliable DNS resolution at all times, especially in combination with DHCP.
The &admin_node; and &kube; API server; must both have valid fully-qualified domain names (FQDN). If the cluster has a single &master_node;, then this is the &kube; API server.
Both these FQDNs are required during installation. They cannot subsequently be added or changed.
The &admin_node; must be visible from a separate machine on your organization's network, and accessible via a web browser, in order to complete the installation.
All nodes must be able to resolve the name of the &admin_node;. It is not required for &worker_node;s to have resolvable names, although this is not problematic and may aid troubleshooting.
For clusters with multiple &master_node;s:
There must be an odd number of &master_node;s.
All &master_node;s must be accessible via a single FQDN.
If the FQDN only points to a single &master_node; and it is removed, cluster functionality will degrade. For this reason, using load-balancing is recommended.

important.title: Unique Host Names
important.para: All nodes' host names must be unique. If two or more nodes have the same host name, bootstrap of the cluster will fail.

note.title: Clusters without Fully-Qualified Domain Names
note.para: For test purposes, IP addresses can be substituted for the FQDNs for the &admin_node; and &master_node;, but this is not supported for production deployment.

listitem.para: &productname; &productnumber; does not support remote installations with Virtual Network Computing (VNC)..
&productname; is a dedicated cluster-node operating system. Dual-booting with other operating systems is not supported. It must be the only operating system installed on each node.
